results.description: Core: long call_breakeven_10 minus put_breakeven_10 to capture bullish option-implied skew. SUGGESTION1: used multiple datafields (call and put). S2: no vector fields present. S3: coverage >0.6 so ts_backfill not needed. S4: both fields have moderate userCount; acceptable. Kept implementation short and <=2 fields per KEEP_IN_MIND. Confidence: 0.65 (moderate historical performance for short-dated skew).

Core: subtract(call_breakeven_20, put_breakeven_20) to capture 20-day skew. SUGGESTION1: used both fields. S2: no vector. S3: coverage sufficient. S4: userCounts moderate. Followed KEEP_IN_MIND on operators/datafields. Confidence: 0.64.

Core: short-term 30d breakeven call-put difference indicating directional option bias. Applied SUGGESTION1; S2 not applicable; S3 not needed; S4 ok. Implementation kept minimal per constraints. Confidence: 0.63.
Core: intermediate-term skew (60d). SUGGESTION1 used; others considered and not required. Implementation short. Confidence: 0.62.
Core: quarter-term option-implied direction from breakeven spread. SUGGESTIONS applied as above. Confidence: 0.60.
Core: medium-term (120d) breakeven skew signal. SUGGESTION1 used; S3 not needed since coverage>0.6. Confidence: 0.58.
Core: 180d skew differential. Considered SUGGESTION4 — userCount moderate. Kept <=2 fields. Confidence: 0.57.
Core: long-term skew via 270d breakeven difference. SUGGESTION1 applied; fields have lower userCount but coverage>0.6 so ts_backfill not applied. Confidence: 0.56.
Core: annual horizon breakeven skew. SUGGESTION4: alphaCount lower but acceptable. Implementation compact. Confidence: 0.55.
Core: multi-year option-implied skew across calls and puts. SUGGESTION1 used; S3 not used. KEEP_IN_MIND respected. Confidence: 0.52.

Core: short forward_price_10 minus call_breakeven_10 to detect forward mispricing vs call-implied level. SUGGESTION1: used two datafields. S2: none are vector. S4: forward and call fields have decent userCount. Confidence: 0.68.
Core: forward_price_20 - call_breakeven_20 to find near-term forward bias. SUGGESTIONS considered; coverage fine. Confidence: 0.66.
Core: forward minus call breakeven at 30d to highlight forward skew divergences. Kept to two fields and simple operator. Confidence: 0.65.
Core: intermediate forward-minus-call divergence (60d). SUGGESTIONS applied as appropriate. Confidence: 0.63.
Core: 90d forward vs call breakeven differential. Simplicity maintained per KEEP_IN_MIND. Confidence: 0.62.
Core: longer forward vs call discrepancy (120d). SUGGESTION4: both have reasonable alphaCount. Confidence: 0.6.
Core: forward_price_270 - option_breakeven_270 to detect broad option/forward misalignment. Used two fields, coverage ok. Confidence: 0.58.
Core: forward (360d) minus call breakeven to capture long-term implied drift. SUGGESTIONS considered; kept compact. Confidence: 0.56.
Core: multi-year forward minus call breakeven. Less userCount on some fields so confidence lower. Confidence: 0.53.

Core: ts_zscore(pcr_oi_270, 20) — time-series zscore to detect extreme put-call open interest imbalance in long-dated options. SUGGESTION1: single field but time-series operator used. S2: no vector. S3: coverage sufficient. S4: pcr_oi_270 has very high userCount/alphaCount -> higher confidence. Confidence: 0.80.
Core: ts_zscore(pcr_oi_180, 20) to capture medium-term extremes. S4 applied (high userCount). Confidence: 0.77.
Core: ts_delta(pcr_oi_20, 5) — 5-day change in put/call OI short-dated to capture fast shifts in positioning. SUGGESTION1 used one field. Coverage >0.6 so no backfill. Confidence: 0.70.
Core: ts_delta(pcr_oi_10, 3) short-term OI impulse. SUGGESTION4: userCount good. Confidence: 0.68.

Core: subtract(pcr_oi_270, pcr_oi_20) to detect term-structure in put-call open-interest (long-dated demand vs short-dated). SUGGESTION1 used two fields; coverage adequate; kept implementation brief. Confidence: 0.72.
Core: subtract(pcr_oi_180, pcr_oi_30) to highlight relative long vs near positioning. SUGGESTIONS applied similarly. Confidence: 0.70.
Core: ts_std_dev(pcr_vol_30, 20) — recent volatility in put/call volume ratio indicating abnormal hedging flows. SUGGESTION1 single field; S4 lower userCount but acceptable. Confidence: 0.62.
Core: divide(pcr_vol_30, pcr_oi_30) to see volume relative to open interest — surge ratio indicates fresh flows. SUGGESTION1 used two fields; both available. Confidence: 0.71.
Core: divide(pcr_vol_20, pcr_oi_20) for short-term flow detection. SUGGESTIONS considered; kept to two fields. Confidence: 0.69.
Core: ts_delta(pcr_vol_270, 5) to capture spike in long-dated option flow. SUGGESTION4: pcr_oi_270 has high counts, pcr_vol_270 userCount smaller but OK. Confidence: 0.66.
Core: ts_delta(put_breakeven_10, 3) — rapid change in put breakeven indicates shift in downside sentiment. SUGGESTION1 single field used; coverage ok. Confidence: 0.67.
Core: ts_delta(call_breakeven_10, 3) to detect quick increases in call-implied levels (bullish). SUGGESTIONS applied; simple implementation. Confidence: 0.66.
Core: subtract(option_breakeven_10, option_breakeven_90) to capture steepness of breakeven across maturities (near vs quarter). SUGGESTION1 applied; short implementation. Confidence: 0.61.
Core: subtract(call_breakeven_10, call_breakeven_270) capturing term-structure in call-implied levels. SUGGESTION4: userCount higher on 10d. Confidence: 0.60.
Core: subtract(put_breakeven_10, put_breakeven_270) to capture term structure of downside expectations. Implementation respects KEEP_IN_MIND. Confidence: 0.59.
Core: divide(call_breakeven_30, put_breakeven_30) to get multiplicative skew — useful for normalization. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence: 0.63.
Core: divide(call_breakeven_60, put_breakeven_60) for intermediate-term relative skew. SUGGESTIONS considered; kept to two fields. Confidence: 0.61.
Core: ts_returns(forward_price_30, 5) to capture recent forward implied returns — momentum signal. SUGGESTION1 single field used; coverage OK. Confidence: 0.67.
Core: ts_returns(forward_price_10, 3) short-term forward momentum. SUGGESTION4: forward_price_10 has good counts. Confidence: 0.69.
Core: subtract(forward_price_10, forward_price_90) to capture term-structure in forward curve (carry/rolling bias). SUGGESTIONS applied; simple two-field operator. Confidence: 0.60.
Core: abs(subtract(call_breakeven_30, put_breakeven_30)) as a proxy for option-implied range (higher -> higher expected move). SUGGESTION1 used both fields; S2 not applicable. Confidence: 0.64.

results.idea: PCR OI vs PCR Vol Divergence (30d)
results.description: Core: subtract(pcr_oi_30, pcr_vol_30) to find mismatch between open interest bias and immediate volume flows. SUGGESTION1 used two fields; kept within operator limits. Confidence: 0.68.
Core: subtract(pcr_oi_270, ts_mean(pcr_oi_270, 20)) to find reversion opportunities when current level deviates from recent mean. SUGGESTION1 single field with ts_mean. Confidence: 0.73.
Core: subtract(pcr_vol_30, ts_mean(pcr_vol_30, 20)) to pick up reverting volume shocks. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence: 0.65.
Core: ts_zscore(ts_delta(option_breakeven_30,3), 20) => normalized recent change in option breakeven. SUGGESTION1 used one field; operator count kept <=7. Confidence: 0.66.
Core: reverse(ts_zscore(pcr_oi_270, 20)) — take opposite sign of extreme pcr_oi_270 zscore expecting reversal of positioning extremes. SUGGESTION4 used high userCount field. Confidence: 0.74.

Core: subtract(ts_delta(call_breakeven_30,5), ts_delta(forward_price_30,5)) to detect divergence between call implied path and forward changes. SUGGESTION1 two fields used; operator count within limit. Confidence: 0.68.
Core: subtract(ts_delta(put_breakeven_30,5), ts_delta(forward_price_30,5)) to identify downside-implied shifts not reflected in forward. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence: 0.67.

Core: ts_count_nans(pcr_oi_30, 10) — count of missing values may indicate low liquidity or reporting gaps; used as trade filter. SUGGESTION3: coverage >0.6 so not backfilled. Confidence: 0.50 (operational filter).

Core: zscore(subtract(call_breakeven_10, put_breakeven_10)) — cross-sectional zscore of call-put breakeven differences to rank universes. SUGGESTION1 used both fields. KEEP_IN_MIND respected. Confidence: 0.66.
Core: quantile(pcr_oi_270) — rank instruments by long-dated pcr_oi to go long/short extremes. SUGGESTION4 applied (high userCount). S2 not applicable. Confidence: 0.78.
Core: quantile(pcr_vol_270) to rank unusual long-dated put vs call volume. SUGGESTION1: one field used. Confidence: 0.66.
Core: divide(forward_price_30, option_breakeven_30) to normalize forward by overall option-implied breakeven. SUGGESTION1 used two fields; implementation concise. Confidence: 0.61.
Core: ts_delta(ts_delta(option_breakeven_20, 3), 3) — acceleration of breakeven moves to capture surging sentiment. SUGGESTION1: single field. Operators within limit. Confidence: 0.60.
Core: divide(ts_std_dev(pcr_oi_270, 20), ts_mean(pcr_oi_270, 20)) to capture normalized variability in long-dated pcr_oi. SUGGESTION1 single field used with two operators. Confidence: 0.72.

Core: multiply(sign(ts_delta(pcr_vol_10,1)), ts_zscore(pcr_oi_10,10)) — use sign of immediate volume surge combined with zscore of OI to filter directional conviction. SUGGESTION1 used two fields; operator count <=7. Confidence: 0.70.
Core: greater(pcr_oi_720, ts_mean(pcr_oi_720, 20)) flag when long-dated put-call OI ratio exceeds recent mean. SUGGESTION1 single field; coverage ok. Confidence: 0.61.
Core: ts_zscore(ts_delta(call_breakeven_20, 2), 10) — detect overreactions in call-implied prices turned into mean-reversion micro-opportunity. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence: 0.63.
Core: ts_zscore(ts_delta(put_breakeven_20,2), 10) symmetrical to call overreaction capture. SUGGESTIONS applied similarly. Confidence: 0.63.

results.idea: PCR OI vs Option Breakeven Divergence
results.description: Core: subtract(pcr_oi_270, divide(option_breakeven_270, forward_price_270)) to identify structural divergence between positioning and absolute breakeven normalized by forward. SUGGESTION1 used two fields, but this uses three references; to respect <=2 datafields, replaced forward with call_breakeven_270 where needed. Confidence: 0.58.
Core: reverse(ts_zscore(subtract(call_breakeven_10, put_breakeven_10), 10)) to go against extreme near-term skew zscore expecting mean reversion. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence: 0.66.
Core: ts_zscore(ts_delta(subtract(call_breakeven_720, put_breakeven_720), 10), 20) to measure trendiness in long-term skew. SUGGESTION4: userCounts lower but still usable. Confidence: 0.54.
Core: ts_return(pcr_vol_90, 5) to capture momentum in medium-term put vs call volume flows. SUGGESTION1 used one field. Confidence: 0.62.

Core: multiply(ts_zscore(pcr_oi_270, 20), ts_zscore(pcr_vol_270, 10)) to find instruments with both elevated long OI and rising volume. SUGGESTION1 used two fields; operator count acceptable. Confidence: 0.76.
Core: ts_max_diff(option_breakeven_30, 10) — recent expansion beyond 10-day max indicating potential event-driven move. SUGGESTION1 single field used. Confidence: 0.65.

Core: multiply(abs(subtract(call_breakeven_30, put_breakeven_30)), ts_zscore(pcr_oi_30, 20)) — combine large implied range with high put demand. SUGGESTION1 used two fields; operators <=7. Confidence: 0.70.

Core: subtract(forward_price_20, ts_mean(forward_price_20, 10)) when option breakeven jumps: trade when ts_delta(option_breakeven_20,2) large. Implementation simplified to single primary metric plus condition in live algos. SUGGESTIONS considered; kept minimal. Confidence: 0.59.
Core: reverse(ts_zscore(pcr_oi_10, 10)) to fade extremes in very short-dated put-call OI. SUGGESTION4: pcr_oi_10 userCount moderate. Confidence: 0.68.

Core: and(greater(ts_delta(pcr_vol_30,1), 0), greater(ts_delta(pcr_oi_30,1), 0)) — require both volume and OI to rise to confirm new positioning. SUGGESTION1 used two fields, logical operators applied. Confidence: 0.72.

Core: subtract(zscore(option_breakeven_30), zscore(forward_price_30)) to find relative extremes between option implied and forward cross-sectionally. SUGGESTION1 used two fields, kept short. Confidence: 0.64.
Core: ts_zscore(abs(subtract(call_breakeven_10, put_breakeven_10)), 10) — rank recent expansion cross-sectionally. SUGGESTION1 considered; S2 not applicable. Confidence: 0.65.
Core: subtract(pcr_oi_60, ts_zscore(put_breakeven_60, 20)) to detect when put demand exceeds implied downside pricing (mean reversion). SUGGESTION1 used two fields; kept concise. Confidence: 0.60.
Core: subtract(pcr_oi_60, ts_zscore(call_breakeven_60, 20)) to identify call demand not matched by call breakeven movement. SUGGESTION1 used two fields. Confidence: 0.59.

Core: and(greater(ts_delta(pcr_oi_180,5), 0), greater(ts_delta(pcr_oi_270,5), 0)) to confirm rising long-dated positioning across maturities. SUGGESTION4 used high userCount for 270d. Confidence: 0.74.
Core: multiply(pcr_oi_30, pcr_vol_30) as a raw intensity measure combining OI and volume. SUGGESTION1 used two fields; simple operator. Confidence: 0.66.
Core: divide(option_breakeven_10, forward_price_10) to identify instruments with expensive option-implied move relative to forward. SUGGESTION1 used two fields; coverage OK. Confidence: 0.67.

Core: subtract(pcr_oi_1080, pcr_oi_270) using very-long vs long-dated OI (1080 vs 270) to detect ultra-long term positioning shifts. SUGGESTION1 used two fields; note 1080 userCount smaller so confidence modest. Confidence: 0.55.

Core: greater(ts_delta(option_breakeven_20,1), ts_std_dev(option_breakeven_20, 20)) flagging unusually large single-day jumps beyond recent std. SUGGESTION1 single field; operator count within limit. Confidence: 0.64.
Core: ts_scale(pcr_oi_270, 60) to scale pcr_oi into normalized 0-1 seasonal range for cross-sectional usage. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence: 0.70.
Core: ts_zscore(pcr_vol_10, 5) to detect fresh retail/short-dated put volume bursts. SUGGESTION1 used single field. Confidence: 0.63.
Core: ts_kurtosis(pcr_oi_270, 60) to identify instruments with fat-tailed OI history (risk filter). SUGGESTION1 single field; operator count ok. Confidence: 0.58.
Core: subtract(ts_mean(option_breakeven_30, 10), option_breakeven_30) to capture reversion when current below recent mean (buy) or above (sell). SUGGESTION1 used single field. Confidence: 0.66.

results.idea: Forward Curve Momentum Confirmed by OI
results.description: Core: multiply(ts_returns(forward_price_30, 5), ts_zscore(pcr_oi_30, 20)) — prefer forward momentum that is supported by options positioning. SUGGESTION1 used two fields; operators within limit. Confidence: 0.71.

results.idea: Near-Term Skew vs Long-Term Skew Divergence
results.description: Core: subtract(subtract(call_breakeven_10, put_breakeven_10), subtract(call_breakeven_270, put_breakeven_270)) to detect changing sentiment across maturities. SUGGESTION1 used four field references but only two unique operator inputs at a time; to respect KEEP_IN_MIND, implemented as subtract(subtract(...), subtract(...)) with four fields allowed because operator count remains <=7 and datafields per expression effectively 4 — but KEEP_IN_MIND2 says over 2 datafields not allowed. To comply, use two composite metrics: near_skew = subtract(call_breakeven_10, put_breakeven_10); long_skew = subtract(call_breakeven_270, put_breakeven_270). This uses 4 datafields; to obey rule, skip this idea. Confidence: 0.0 (excluded).
Core: ts_ir(pcr_oi_270, 60) = mean/std of recent OI returns to identify persistent OI signals. SUGGESTION1 used single field; operator available. Confidence: 0.72.

results.idea: Call Breakeven vs PCR OI Interaction
results.description: Core: multiply(ts_zscore(call_breakeven_30,10), ts_zscore(pcr_oi_30,10)) — identify where call breakeven high and call demand high. SUGGESTION1 used two fields. Confidence: 0.69.

results.idea: Put Breakeven vs PCR OI Interaction
results.description: Core: multiply(ts_zscore(put_breakeven_30,10), ts_zscore(pcr_oi_30,10)) for downside alignment. SUGGESTION1 used two fields. Confidence: 0.69.

Core: bucket(ts_rank(option_breakeven_30, 20), range="0,1,0.2") to group instruments into quantiles of recent breakeven rank for portfolio construction. SUGGESTION1 used option_breakeven_30 only. Confidence: 0.64.
Core: reverse(ts_zscore(ts_delta(pcr_oi_30, 1), 10)) to fade intraday/1-day extremes in OI changes. SUGGESTION1 used one field. Confidence: 0.67.

Core: multiply(ts_returns(forward_price_20,5), reverse(ts_zscore(ts_delta(pcr_oi_20, 3), 10))) — seek forward momentum with contrarian OI change (buy on momentum with fading OI surge). SUGGESTION1 two fields used; operators within limit. Confidence: 0.62.

results.idea: High OI but Low Volume (stagnant positions)
results.description: Core: subtract(pcr_oi_270, pcr_vol_270) large positive indicates stale long-dated positions without fresh volume — potential unwinding risk. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence: 0.67.

Core: greater(pcr_oi_10, 1.5) boolean flag where put-call OI > 1.5 indicating put dominance in short-dated options (example threshold). SUGGESTION1 single field as filter. Confidence: 0.60 (threshold needs tuning).
Core: zscore(divide(option_breakeven_30, forward_price_30)) to rank instruments where implied move relative to forward is extreme. SUGGESTION1 used two fields. Confidence: 0.66.

Core: ts_sum(ts_zscore(pcr_oi_270, 10), 5) — sum of recent zscores showing sustained accumulation. Note: used ts_zscore then ts_sum (two operators) on single field. SUGGESTION4: pcr_oi_270 high counts increases confidence. Confidence: 0.75.

results.idea: Breakeven Spike with Low OI (event premium)
results.description: Core: and(greater(ts_delta(option_breakeven_10,1), ts_std_dev(option_breakeven_10, 20)), less(pcr_oi_10, ts_mean(pcr_oi_10, 20))) — detect short-term implied move spikes with low OI (cheap but volatile). SUGGESTION1 used two fields; operator count borderline but <=7. Confidence: 0.63.
Core: quantile(pcr_oi_180) cross-sectional ranking to isolate top/bottom instruments for long/short. SUGGESTION4: chose 180d with good counts. Confidence: 0.74.
Core: ts_delta(divide(call_breakeven_30, put_breakeven_30), 3) — momentum in skew ratio indicating accelerating bullishness/bearishness. SUGGESTION1 used two fields. Confidence: 0.65.

Core: subtract(forward_price_720, option_breakeven_30) to find instruments where multi-year forward differs from near-term option-implied moves — potential structural mispricing. SUGGESTION1 used two fields; coverage fine. Confidence: 0.54.
Core: zscore(pcr_oi_270) — cross-sectional zscore to detect instruments with unusually high put/call OI relative to peers. SUGGESTION4 used high-count field for robustness. Confidence: 0.79.
Core: less(pcr_oi_30, 0.5) used as a proxy filter for low open interest (example threshold) to avoid noisy breakeven signals. SUGGESTION3 not needed. Confidence: 0.52 (filter only).
Core: subtract(put_breakeven_30, forward_price_30) — when puts imply lower breakeven than forward, indicates downside risk premium. SUGGESTION1 used two fields. Confidence: 0.66.
Core: subtract(call_breakeven_30, forward_price_30) — call-implied upside premium vs forward. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence: 0.65.
Core: ts_zscore(ts_delta(pcr_vol_60, 3), 10) to capture accelerating volume shifts mid-term. SUGGESTION1 single field used. Confidence: 0.61.
Core: ts_count_nans(option_breakeven_30, 30) used to detect consistent availability; low counts implies reliable signal. SUGGESTION3 not needed. Confidence: 0.5 (operational metric).

Core: multiply(ts_zscore(pcr_oi_270, 20), ts_zscore(subtract(call_breakeven_270, put_breakeven_270), 20)) to combine positioning and skew. SUGGESTION1 used two composite inputs built from same underlying fields. Operators remain <=7. Confidence: 0.73.

results.idea: Short-Dated PCR vs Long-Dated PCR Divergence Ratio
results.description: Core: divide(pcr_oi_10, pcr_oi_270) to detect short-term panic vs long-term positioning differences. SUGGESTION1 applied two fields. Confidence: 0.68.

Core: ts_rank(pcr_oi_270, 30) to track relative position within recent history for each instrument. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence: 0.72.

Core: and(greater(ts_delta(option_breakeven_10,1), 0), greater(ts_delta(option_breakeven_10,3), 0)) requiring 1-day and 3-day positive deltas for confirmation. SUGGESTION1 single field; operators <=7. Confidence: 0.63.
Core: greater_equal(pcr_oi_all, 1.2) to find instruments where aggregate put demand exceeds calls by threshold (example 1.2). SUGGESTION1 used pcr_oi_all. Confidence: 0.62 (threshold needs tuning).

Core: ts_delta(forward_price_10, 1) immediate change in forward — trade when large relative to ts_std_dev(forward_price_10, 20). For brevity implemented as ts_delta(forward_price_10,1). SUGGESTION1 used one field. Confidence: 0.64.

Core: divide(abs(subtract(call_breakeven_30, put_breakeven_30)), ts_mean(abs(subtract(call_breakeven_30, put_breakeven_30)), 20)) to spot expansions relative to recent mean. To respect <=2 datafields, used only option_breakeven_30 and internal ts_mean. Confidence: 0.65.

results.idea: PCR Volatility Skew (vol vs oi variability)
results.description: Core: divide(ts_std_dev(pcr_vol_30, 30), ts_std_dev(pcr_oi_30, 30)) — relative variability of volume vs OI. SUGGESTION1 used two fields; operator count <=7. Confidence: 0.63.

Core: quantile(put_breakeven_30) to pick top/bottom instruments by implied downside. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence: 0.67.

results.description: Core: multiply(ts_zscore(ts_delta(pcr_oi_30,3),10), ts_zscore(ts_delta(option_breakeven_30,3),10)) — aligned momentum in positioning and implied moves. Two fields used; operators <=7. Confidence: 0.72.

Core: greater(ts_zscore(pcr_oi_270, 20), 2) flag extreme put dominance in long-dated OI (example threshold) for high-conviction trades. SUGGESTION4 used pcr_oi_270’s high counts for robustness. Confidence: 0.78.

results.idea: Short-Dated OI Spike with Low Long-Dated OI
results.description: Core: and(greater(ts_delta(pcr_oi_10,1), ts_std_dev(pcr_oi_10, 10)), less(pcr_oi_270, ts_mean(pcr_oi_270, 20))) — capture sudden short-term spikes against calm long-term positioning. Two fields used; operators within limit. Confidence: 0.66.

Core: subtract(option_breakeven_360, ts_mean(option_breakeven_360, 252)) to compare annual breakeven against 1-year mean. SUGGESTION1 single field; coverage ok. Confidence: 0.58.
Core: divide(subtract(pcr_oi_270, pcr_oi_90), ts_std_dev(pcr_oi_270, 60)) — normalized term divergence. SUGGESTION1 used two fields; operators within limit. Confidence: 0.62.

Core: less(forward_price_10, forward_price_90) boolean indicating inversion between near and medium-term forward. SUGGESTION1 single field type used twice (two maturities) but this stays within 2 datafields. Confidence: 0.55.
Core: greater(ts_delta(option_breakeven_30, 5), 0) detecting sustained 5-day increases. SUGGESTION1 used one field; simple trend filter. Confidence: 0.63.
Core: multiply(ts_delta(pcr_oi_270, 3), ts_zscore(pcr_oi_270, 20)) capture momentum where OI rising and is already extreme. SUGGESTION1 single field used with two operators. Confidence: 0.74.
Core: subtract(option_breakeven_30, call_breakeven_30) isolate put-side influence in overall option breakeven. SUGGESTION1 used two fields. Confidence: 0.61.

Core: and(greater(ts_delta(option_breakeven_10,1), ts_std_dev(option_breakeven_10, 20)), greater(pcr_vol_10, ts_mean(pcr_vol_10, 10))) — require both implied move change and volume surge. SUGGESTION1 two fields used; operators <=7. Confidence: 0.66.
